Nick's Blog

Google Analytics

14 November 2005

Back in March of 2005 Google aquired Urchin, a web statistics and analytics firm. Urchin, the product, was fairly simple to use and customize and I've used it on on a few different sites before.

Recently, Google has announced a product called Google Analytics. This seems to be an implementation of the recently acquired urchin webstats. It provides some basic statistical information about a given page or website and can let users create custom reports and get coverage information. It also looks to have some tie-ins to the adsense network. Perhaps another free tool for spammers?

Don't give them too much credit though, this system is neither new or special, it just has a Google brand logo on it. Urchin is one of the many products out there that do this, not to mention several of the free and open source applications like awstats or webalizer.
